QUwdlbb5QfAYMQef64zqbQ.text: Great food authentic freshly handmade. The owner is super nice and prepares food however you like.

OwQ0ukaGvQ6ZiBfYM8nSPw.text: Great fast friendly service. I stopped in to grab lunch to go. I got the Italian & it was Fabulous!  Bread was soft & fresh. Meat & cheese was fresh & had a great taste! I'm not a New Yorker, but I like the food!! A must stop if you're in the area. I'll definitely be going back!

8tx2eINIquP6m9X0AueTZg.text: had a great breakfast there - good quantities of good quality at a good price! will be back for a Taylor ham egg and cheese on a good seeded roll!!!!!!!

3obRGOPXavrXihc6kwnbtQ.text: My wife and I stopped in for breakfast this morning and I have to say,  Awesome!!!!!!!!  Taylor Ham (Pork Roll in Philly) and egg and cheese sandwich.  I've found my Saturday morning breakfast spot.

O7lsxZk8yT15R_eGAGwyDg.text: Great place to get breakfast or lunch. Stopped in the other day for breakfast. Got a sesame bagel with taylor ham and cheese, and some potato wedges. My wife got a breakfast wrap, and she loved it. Mine was outstanding. They also have some great desserts that they ship in straight from New York. Can't wait to go back.

MpdIwpfp0pchYhu_0hKMbw.text: We've chosen to eat at Sileo's NY Deli quite a few times already. Never disappoints! Last night was no different. The food is great, and the service is excellent! The Ruben is awesome, the Steve's Special is very good, and the Hot Dog is great. The Buffalo Chicken wrap wasn't on the menu, but Steve made it for me anyway, and it was the bomb!  As a fellow Long Islander, I am definitely a fan of Sileo's!!  Give it a try, for sure!

aLgDYPu_B0jkuziVEoMCeA.text: My boyfriend and I went here after seeing a movie and we absolutely loved it!  We both got the Rueben, fries and a drink and the rueben was out of the world!  The owner was there, greeted us, explained the menu and was full of energy which was also great.  Many times you go to a restaurant and feel as though the workers do not wish to be there.  He was wonderful!  Will definitely be going back and trying other menu items including the homemade pastries.

usklY5berdJu75zeZTuOag.text: Sandwich was okay.  The service was unbelievable slow.  We sat and sat waiting for two simple sandwiches to be made.    I hope they work on that because it's nice to have another place to grab lunch or breakfast in the area.

T1pWIvouY-nljMNJSFuvjg.text: Amazing sandwiches!! For breakfast, definitely try the Taylor ham, egg, and cheese! You won't be disappointed with anything from here!

3gvQvsUdrXkoc3O-Vvi6kw.text: Amazing food and the staff are great. True New Yorkers doing their thing. Steve's sandwiches are to die for.

5YnWDte3_6v0T4ZumxgMiw.text: If you want a True taste of NYC...Then make your way over to this place. AWESOME food and owners.

L6shKUSE8Kn6CCiCQydFWg.text: Outstanding! Italian sausage sub! Meatball sub! Love it. Will definitely be back. Oh, and the desserts! Already thinking about next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Wall menu

4AD3YQ53UBWv6eHVzJ3vUA.text: I have been here twice now and service is friendly they make you feel like family... everything I've eaten there is top notch make think of places back in Jersey ... and the bake goods are worth going for... by the slice or just want a sub or a cannoli this place is it!!!!! Oh did mention they do breakfast!!!! Love this place!!!!!

DXlSwE9Buqpjn3j9AlCHyA.text: This is the best Deli around. Best Italian sub and Reuben I have ever had. So glad to have an awesome place like this in Indian trail.

JskIHD8jH3pMLVcjHjWEJg.text: Great subs, and hotdogs. Trying to find something bad but just can't mustard it. Try the Taylor ham egg and cheese on a Bagel. Your taste buds will thank you.

DvKricCJHo1qtHMp1CEb_w.text: My new favorite in town! The food is very fresh and is always delicious. They don't skimp on meats like some places do. Fair prices and quick service with a huge menu. The only problem I've had is that I tend to want to go here for most meals instead of cooking at home!

zAs0vSelb5k0kNIJzj3JXA.text: Fantastic food, even better service! These guys really know how to make you feel welcomed!

YPBQX9uTb2hkXYTzuprwUA.text: Delicious!! They have these rainbow cakes my uncle made and they were incredible! So glad to have a deli/restaurant in the area!

4wEUeZK5XIAmK8-HAm0ftw.text: Most addictive Philly cheesesteak ever! You can't get sandwiches this good, this fast anywhere! Also, one of the best reuben sandwiches you'll find! I highly recommend the Taylor ham, egg and cheese sandwiches as well. The meats are cut so thin, and stacked high so flavor is maxed!

oEtY4ma2onhh0Tlp63iCUg.text: Best NY style food around. Great food. Great customer service. If you haven't tried there food or desserts your truly missing out!

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Best Italian around
Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. They care about their customers more than any other place around! Best customer service!

Th5ara5_Qh2_1eLDZ5AIzg.text: Great food and friendly service. I had the Taylor ham egg and cheese on an everything bagel and it was perfect NY style. My wife had the Italian sub and we took half of it home because it was so packed. We will be regulars here.

-5dZ9-UoQvfBgDa14tHPhg.text: Decided to try after seeing a movie. Had the meatball parmesan..delish! Took a whoppie sampler home for dessert, and can see why they sell out! Owner was super nice, too.. prefer supporting a family owned business! Going back soon for breakfast:)

Ei5Fo4-IGbM8oSkrqVmyhw.text: Had the turkey wrap, was very good. Staff was friendly too. Will definitely go back. Good kids menu too.

h7xWMz3NvmjH6B-Ny4lgsQ.text: Awesome little gem near the Sun Valley movie theater.  Great food at a great price!  Has a very New York vibe, I love the atmosphere here.  Highly recommended!

8SkSw1qT1BirIQ598yZBwg.text: Ever since I discovered this place I have been going TONS of time.. philly cheese and the Italian sub are AMAZING ... don't let me get started on breakfasts and most importantly customer service.  Steve is the best and so friendly! I have my family and friends hooked on this place.  It's clean great vibe ... oh and their desserts OMG!

tkqOHbQ0SZFTYsDiQvOShw.text: Went into sileo's on Monday for lunch and got the Chicken Parm sandwich.  The sandwich was average at best.  The chicken was a little chewy for my liking.  I like a chicken parm that has a crunch to it.  It was definitely decent. Because I ate the whole thing but it wasn't my favorite.  I was in Sileo's a couple weeks ago and had an amazing turkey club.  Couldn't believe how much turkey they put on the sandwich.  I could barely get my mouth around it.  I will continue to visit and try different menu items.

VifgprpQ7-LM-RvEbvORjA.text: I really enjoy Sileo's NY Deli. I've had his Reuben sandwich and the Taylor Ham / Pork Roll twice and loved them all. They also happen to have the best Cajun potato chips made, the Crawtaters. Every time I go in there, he's got some new Italian treat to try and they are awesome as well. Steve listens to all of his customers and makes everything to your liking. He's also a great ambassador for the local community.  Give him a call @ (704) 776-4340.

vHPiNvaTmb2Cer89uYgrYQ.text: Great Philly-style bread for the subs.  We had a Philly cheese steak and the chicken parm and we're very happy. Even the pickle was good. The vegetables are cut fresh to order. They have a huge dessert case so we sampled a variety of Italian cookies, cannoli, cheesecake, brownie cake, pumpkin whoopie pie and coffee cake. They have specials every day and Wednesday they had half price pizza slices which was a terrific deal for the family. The owner is very friendly and personable. He went out of his way to make us feel welcomed. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Philly cheesesteak made with fresh cut roast beef, fresh vegetables and authentic Philly style bread. We loved it!

LhkldY6w4PnvvBej515-pQ.text: Best Reuben Sandwich in Indian Trail, NC. I eat here at least twice a month and always eat The Reuben with macaroni salad and a V8 tomato juice, they always get it Right

XVwQRtn-mE3rgoo2bGhH3g.text: Best Taylor ham egg and cheese sandwich ever.  Pancakes are better then pancake houses. Good family owned restaurant where the owner cooks the food from the heart.

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States

L8XU0T-gvN8_V4Dm2-0y0g.text: I've been looking for a decent sandwich in Union County/South Charlotte since moving from San Francisco in 2015.  If you like Subway - no offense - but you may not get it.  However, if you wretch at Subway's preservative-laden mystery meat, chintzy portions (measured out slice by excruciating slice by disinterested stoned employees), dry bread and awful toppings, read on.  I discovered Sileo's a little less than a year ago and make the trip from Weddington once a week now -  a take-out lunch order has become part of the weekend routine for our family.  As much as I'd love to try another menu item, the Philly cheesesteak and Italian are so good and consistent, it's hard to deviate.  The turkey club comes highly recommended (wife and daughter) while our son inhales the grilled chicken.  All the signature sandwiches come on GREAT rolls, are PACKED with meat, cheese, and fresh veggies (when included/added) and they wrap in wax paper AND foil?  Why does this matter?  Takeout hot sandwiches are still fresh and piping hot after a 20 min drive (thanks to the foil), and the wax paper means they don't taste like foil!  You'll probably catch owner Steve at the flattop in back, coordinating orders or working the register.  I've watched him patiently coach nervous new employees while simultaneously working the grill and greeting customers with his arm in a sling following an injury!  Simply awesome establishment that gets everything right.

thC05H--2e8duY4JQg7mzw.text: I was really excited to try this place out. However, expectations and reality don't always meet. I ordered off of their specials board outside that had the chicken philly listed as a combo which included fries and a drink for $10. I received my mediocre at best sandwich with fries. When I went to check out I was charged for the fries as well. When I asked regarding this I was told that was only for one of their specials even though their board had it listed at the bottom as if it applied to all. Will not go back for below average food and False advertising.

ratO_rIvKVK9zC8U72zntA.text: Love the food here every time I visit.  The owner and staff are so friendly. Great NY food.  The hot dogs and the Bacon and egg on a roll are my favorate.  My husband loves the Ruben.

CeoGYr7dwgyYI1PEjbu6AQ.text: Finally went for our first visit and Oh My Gosh! The food was amazing! I had the antipasta which took me back to my childhood! I haven't had a salad that good in years! My husband had the Cajun chicken wrap. It had just the right amount of everything on it! It was perfect! The atmosphere was great everyone was so friendly! We will definitely be coming back more often!!

VA7PJcaAUEfIOgNYnZiCFg.text: Great customer service!  They accidentally charged my card twice and when I called back the next day, they were kind enough to give me the refund no questions asked, in cash.  If you go, try the Steve's Special...super good sandwiches.  I'll take them over the big corp sandwhich shop guys anyday!

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. The other side of THE MENU.
Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. THE MENU

ehTrpRiy0GmoAxAULzVtWg.text: Top notch place - the real deal!  I've had their Chef salad, knish, egg salad, coffee, buttered roll, Philly cheesesteak, chicken cutlet salad and every one is awesome!  The owner is so friendly and customer oriented ...definitely my new favorite place!  Let's keep this place in business!!

ScbzoD1iRbsfT322vCQ8CQ.text: Was getting my car worked on and decided to give this little place a try. I'm so glad I did! While the place is small the food they serve is not. You have a plethora of options to choose from, I don't know if I'll ever be able to try it all.  The flavor is robust and delicious! Cant wait to go back and try something else. They also don't skimp on desert if you have a sweet tooth. Do yourself a favor and try this place out, seriously, it's fantastic and you'll love it!

7OyWtEuGDnR1PxjTIcGDGQ.text: First of all, they have gone to the trouble to have both Coke and Pepsi products. Service was very good.

eX6cCiAzPqJp5xHwv9V5GA.text: Awesome food and service! Reuben is too die for! Must try for lunch! Breakfast is excellent as well!!!!@

l6a7r_YUqmcit-o2HtT06w.text: in a word just eat. ..always friendly and food is New York move over everyone they are on their way up. .and help our local High Schools with spirit nights and local sports. ...thanks to all of you

0Ky6AJkRGYi-zzvDy-tytQ.text: Cannot say enough good things about this place! The food was fantastic and the people working were very friendly and knowledgeable. I came over to eat lunch with my brother and now I wish that this restaurant was on my side of town in Ballantyne so I could come more often. Looking forward to coming here again sometime! I had the Italian sandwich and the cold cuts tasted fresh and the bread was nice and soft. The sandwich with stuffed to the gills. I didn't really need a side because the sandwich was so big! Fantastic place and feels great to support a local business!

ep8l3zbLbvbUEuDS8MrRvA.text: Always looking for great places to enjoy a bite to eat...this definitely fit the bill. Friendly staff, clean and great tasting food. I had the chicken bacon wrap special. Savory chicken, crisp lettuce, fresh tomatoes and bacon cooked perfectly. I will definitely be coming back.

OJ7_iygaaARo7iP9ZtzSUg.text: Great place. Love the chicken parm and Taylor ham egg and cheese. My wife really enjoyed their Philly and mother in law said the reuben was great! The staff is very friendly and always put the customer first. This is a great little spot in a very convenient location.

AveRToziGsOx7YQNj5-QVw.text: This place never fails on quality! The sandwich may be pricy,  but worth it! I've been impressed how friendly the management has been when I visit.  Tons of options and irresistible baked goods. It's a gem in the sun valley plaza next to the movie theater.

7QmCXdNkAQt7frkbyDBAsA.text: Do not miss this place!!!  Great food, great service, the best bread... The guys here care about the customer and the food equally.  Just go!

UDZTadFEp8Iz7-n5ryqDog.text: Sileo's is good for a quick bite. The service was good and food was ok. I had the "Philly cheesesteak". It's not a Philly cheesesteak if it's pre cooked deli meat reheated on a flat top, that would be a roast beef sandwich. Not saying it's bad, just not what I anticipated. Sileo should know that, being from New York. I would most likely return for breakfast to try a bagel or a ham and egg sandwich.

Xi7reQZxjnyABP9cHSypvQ.text: Sileo's by far has the most authentic New York deli food. Everything he makes taste better than any other place I've been. Please give them a shout!!!!!

myuLaVYufgKsCQ1pMe_CEQ.text: Local owned and operated restaurant, ordered the philly, it was pretty tasty.  The meat was perfect and the veggies were awesome.  Keep in mind if you want a subway priced sub you won't get it here and for good reason.  The meats, veggies, bread are all fresh and tasty.  Kids got the cheese pizza, it was New York style and they said they loved it as well.  Huge assortment of bakery items, the brownies were out of this world.  Can't wait to go back and try some of the other sandwiches and even breakfast here.

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. The philly.  Amazing!
Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States

cmlL7bdD6bbZ6u2MI1XbcA.text: Steve and and his staff are always friendly and go the extra mile... The sandwiches are always on the money.   If you haven't tried Sileo' s Deli  yet then you need too..

sQ8DLEvfU4ImzYWzsBzHug.text: Delicious authentic NY style sandwiches. Great bread and desserts. Desserts are either from a local bakery or shipped straight from NY. Friendly staff and casual atmosphere full of Yankees memorabilia and NY photos.

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Italian sandwich
Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Chocolate cheesecake-- highly recommend
Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Dessert case with cakes, canoli, and whoopie pies.

WKQZtJISqGAYmEdVBWmjqQ.text: My review is solely on the taste of the meal I had. I wanted to try this place after seeing so many wonderful reviews, it's conveniently located near the movies and we decided to grab lunch before the movie. This was my first time. Staff was friendly . There weren't that many people today. We chose our seats. It was about 1pm, it's a smaller place. Looks like a great selection of items. My friend wanted to order the pizza but was told they don't serve pizza on Mondays. I ordered the special number 1. Chicken wrap with lettuce, cheese, tomato, bacon & honey mustard dressing.  It was ok. Although they did forget to put the bacon. Which probably would have made the Sandwhich. Idk if I'll be back. 1st impressions are hard to make up for. But I did notice they had an awesome selection of desserts so I may come back to try that. A bit disappointed on the Sandwhich I chose.

LvKJNxWuBISMKOZS1vR3sg.text: Holy Wow Wow Wow!  Recent transplant here from Long Island and this is the tastes of home!!  Steve is right there with his hands on working amongst his employees, and has a wonderful reputation of giving back to the community. fyi- Table dining indoors and outdoors. If you haven't been here, you must come here!

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States

J7LgalxNMawKWsuDnS8bOg.text: The truth is that Charlotte has a lot of transplants to this great city. If your from the northern side of this country you will DEFINITELY appreciate the authentic flair and flavor of this local delicatessen. The owner brings in favorites from New York and has the favorites that blow old York out of the water! See Steve for open faced knishes, black and white cookies and all the accompanying flavor the the Big Apple has to offer!

a2Yazz0LldXBB4nCAaOk0w.text: Love Sileos!  This place makes amazing food and no matter what you pick it is gonna be good!

u6H1R7qnH7CqdJrkP3DDqw.text: Husband got a cheesesteak, I got a turkey wrap, both tasty. However, the True gem was the whoopie pies. We got red velvet, and they may be the best I've ever had. We're going to try breakfast next (and buy more whoopie pies to go). Wish it was a little cheaper, but you pay for quality, and I don't mind that.

vn6UZDsA-HTvmeiUaXyRBw.text: This was my first time at this nice little Deli and I was amazed at how big the hamburgers were that they gave you and the prices are very very competitive I would certainly suggest this place to someone looking for a good meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. A heck of a big hamburger full of lettuce tomato and onions very yummy.

GcKiyFOd9PfSvV9qquC7Pg.text: My wife and I visited "Silo's" this afternoon for the very first tine. I have to report that the experience was a very sad one. The best part about the visit was the young man (15 yrs. old) he was more professional and courteous than the adults. They can actually learn "customer service" etiquette from him. Here are the details of my horrible visit.  There was another couple dining at the same time as my wife and I, they were white and we are black. The lady that works in Silo's would pass our table constantly to offer refills on their drinks and to make sure they were enjoying their meal.Only time she would say anything to my wife and I, was when I would summon here to our table before she dashed back behind the counter. One of her many trips to their table, the female worker even suggested dessert to the white couple, then hurried back behind the counter without offering my wife and I desert.  If that behavior wasn't bad enough, the owner who was cooking, came from behind the counter, walked past my wife and to share a story about the establishment next door. He walked over to the table with the white couple, shared his story and a laugh, then walked past our table without so much as an 'eye contact' and returned behind the counter.   As for my dinner, the taste was very bland. There was plenty of meat on my 'Philly Cheese Steak' however it lacked any kind of taste. Here's the finally to the whole discriminatory service we received. As I payed for my meal, my hand accidentally touched her hand during the exchange of money. The white female worker then wiped her hand on her cloths as if I were a diseased Infested person or that the blackness of my skin was hazardous. "The more things change, the more they stay the same". That was the first and last time I will ever frequent a bias establishment that displays discriminatory practices.   It's apparent that this is the culture of this 'mom and pop' shop located next to Sun Valley 14 theater, I only hope that their ignorant, bias, 1960's behavior doesn't affect the 15 yrs old young man, because he has a bright future ahead of him!!! I'm speaking from professional experience of 20 yrs. in the role of Sr. Customer Service Manager for various fortune 100 companies!!

KR7V3EzexzWi7YHpFsbbng.text: Love to dine here w/my boys.  The owner is so nice and friendly and the food is great.  It really reminds me of another NY deli we use to go to when we were stationed in Groton.  It's a cute little restaurant w/great service and great food.

neaw49ZtRAu52DIpG2kOwQ.text: Still considered worst place to eat.  Food is bad and old, and never fresh.  Worst customer support and they ownership is shady.

jd_73VhfJGt5wcgJxHF6Fg.text: Best Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich EVER!!  My wife and I stopped in after a movie at Sun Valley 14 and Wow!!  We will be back Many Times!!!

pM5Y8adA8KIONVkUYvbQ0Q.text: just moved to Charlotte and man was this a great taste of home!! The owner was super friendly and you could tell that this place is his baby. My boyfriend and I split a philly cheesesteak and an italian sandwich. Both were phenomenal. The owner was attentive to our needs and very friendly. He brought us our food and told us to pay at the end. It made me feel like his friend lol. This place somehow has everything. While we were there, fresh cannolis came out of the oven. Someone else came in and got pizza. Is there anything this man CANT do?!?!?! Not all heroes wear capes. Unfortunately I live in north charlotte so I cant frequent this spot a lot BUT if I'm in the area you can best believe I will return!!!! As they say in Sileo's, the customer is king, and this man sure makes me feel like royalty.  Please support this business.

shifzGmWA5ZWw5pYNuI7hw.text: It's a sliver of a place but the food is on point. The spot is tiny but they have a huge selection. We lived in NJ for 16 years so seeing Taylor ham again was a treat.  Inexpensive with an enormous selection - the deli meats are phenomenal. If you're interested in something besides the standard fare (the Hickory Grill next door has consistently failed to impress me) this is a great choice.

OfBfE-4JmnzTdNGmhffLEg.text: This deli is a must try!  All of the food was delicious and they even have NY butter cookies shipped in from New York :). Cannolis are delicious and made on the premises.  Great service, reasonable prices. We will definitely be back and recommend this place to family and friends!

9bvOI8Bd0ykNxOLDa92kVg.text: From the moment I walked in and spoke to the staff I knew I would be back again. I ordered a philly cheese steak (their no. 1 seller) with potato salad and my boyfriend got a meatball sub with French fries. One thing I love about a restaurant is serving drinks in a to go cup and not being shy about drink refills. Everything was just so on point! Our food arrived and not one disappointment it lived up to what I had heard. The sandwich was pretty big so I ended up needing a box and taking more than half home to eat later that evening. Pro tip though bring cash as you get charged a 4 percent fee for using a credit/debit card.

7-28GBseYJbafRLlkgSb8Q.text: It's a delicious locally owned authentic New York deli located in indian trail. They make all their own cakes and get the best quality bread. I ordered a Philly cheesesteak with chips and a slice of cheesecake. The price was right and I would go back

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Cherry cheesecake
Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Philly cheesesteak

N61sfD43OHbcSwq5UnP1XA.text: This place is awesome! The food was outstanding we have been twice already and just moved to the area! great customer service  great sandwiches & burgers  awesome deserts the portions are generous and the people are efficient and friendly highly recommend

mPO7AVA39R0JQMHiu5Vp4w.text: Today, I branched out and ordered the Southern Style Hotdog which consists of mustard, onions, slaw and chili. Now, me being from NC and the owner being from New York, I was curious as to how it would be. The owner assured me it was good and gave me a small sample of the chili. Ok - I'm game!  The hot dog is pretty dang good and what I really loved is that the wiener is split lengthwise before grilling it which, in my opinion, adds to the texture and flavor.  The slaw has a bit more mayonnaise than I'm used to on a hot dog but still good.  Sileo's makes a good hot dog "all the way" - as it's known in the south - and don't forget to add a piping hot order of french fries to your order. I would LOVE to see them add a Chicago-Style dog to their lineup - I would be first in line for that one!  I may be a southerner by birth, however, I'll order a Chicago Dog (run it through the garden!) over a hot dog ATW.      Last and definitely not least, the service, as well as their health grade have always been outstanding - a 99-100 health grade is their norm!!  It's very obvious that the owner really cares about the customer and takes pride in his restaurant and the food he offers.  This is why his deli is such a success!

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Southern Style hot dog.
Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Southern Style hot dog - I added more mustard!
Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States

6SRKJVjnGoCxetS694u9nw.text: I didn't know we had a slice of New York in Indian trail, certainly glad we do. Stopped in for a sandwich with my two boys looking for something a little bit different and boy did we find it.   This is a True New York style deli that serves some great sandwiches. On top of all of that they have tableservice something that doesn't normally come in the deli environment. The girls are in the front were pleasant the food was on point And I know my two boys enjoyed their sandwiches. We will absolutely be back again.

WvqgEQMEYH34CIaCZxQmpw.text: The food is awesome you get more than what your money's worth fast,friendly and the environment is very comforting.

vrC1_td0jmrKEP6JGzc3iw.text: I was so disappointed. I had lunch there between 2 appointments that day. I had read so many good things, that I was looking forward to trying the food. I was dining by myself (no biggie) and the entire time, I felt as if I was intruding on a private party or something! I was very uncomfortable. The owner (I'm assuming) was exchanging pleasantries with the other costumers. Maybe if I was a regular or a friend I would have been treated better. The philly cheesesteak I ordered was about the same as one would get through any pizza delivery place. It was OK. I was really hoping it would be good. I ordered fries as well. Everything was a la carte. The total, for just me, after leaving a tip was $17 and some change! I cannot recommend this place and have absolutely no desire to dine there again. There are much better restaurants in Sun Valley.

WiEFU8VpqxjkHriuhz4x7w.text: Great little place. Stacked pastrami with Swiss on marble rye, delicious! Friendly service and very clean.

27ARCJv8XWe_YE9CHjkIfQ.text: Soon as we walked in we were greeted and promptly got service, owner came out asking customer how everything was, nice touch, we had not order yet , ha stopped at our table and recommend a couple sandwich, another nice touch, ourderd  pasrtrami on rye with potato salad, our order came out in a reasonable amount of time, the pastrami was juice and hot good size portion , the bread lightly toasted, lettuce and tomato ( no core), potato salad is deffirent, somewhat sweet and yogurt or something, not southern style, i did no care for all the prepackaged desserts,  over all i would come back

09DWCeM0iSsiGshjTL6YcA.text: If you are from the north then this is the place to go! Excellent breakfast sandwiches! Husband got the sausage egg and cheese and I got the Taylor ham egg and cheese. In short it's AMAZING! Atmosphere inside in welcoming and clean. We will be back for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States

2QPK9FNWT_rRnD4n4w9CUA.text: I completely understand why Sileo's has 4.5 stars! They also have a sanitation score of 99.5!! And let's just say they have Jimmy John's beat with the delivery time of food.We literally sat at the table,ordered our food,and the food was served in five minutes.It was so fast I observed over time the delivery of other guest orders and it was consistent! Very impressive! My Italian sandwich was very good.More than enough meat and the right amount of vinaigrette to give it the best taste.Our waitress was very sweet as well.The decor reminds you of NY, and I love the Mom/Pop business feel. We will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States

QiPdtxtR6_6r0RGFp55GeQ.text: Fabulous pastrami sandwich!!  I highly recommend their pastrami melt as a former New Yorker myself. The meat is savory & delicious! Their bread tasty homemade & just the right amount of sauce on the sandwiches for both hubs & myself. I want to try their other sandwich menu like the reuben & their desserts sound delicious too from other yelp reviews. The price was reasonable at $8 per sandwich. We did takeout so I need to return for another tasting. Parking is the lot by the Sun Valley movie theater.

RFlpv6j32fDS2ImSrk3gig.text: Stop! Wait! Look very, very closely and before you choose either of its two behemoth neighbors - Hickory Tavern or American Burger - that it is wedged (and somewhat hidden) between, give this authentic little NY style deli a try. On each of our visits, we were greeted by its enthusiastic do-it-all owner, Steve, who obviously loves his business. The dining area is a little tight but immaculate and comfortable. A large poster on the wall makes it crystal clear who the boss is - you, the customer. The entire restaurant glistens and had a 100 sanitary rating during this visit, another indicator of pride of ownership.  A full array of burgers, sandwiches and wraps are available. The Philly Cheese Steak Hoagie and triple decker sandwiches are terrific as are the sides. They also serve up perfectly prepared breakfasts any time of the day.   On this trip, we went with the Italian hoagie and the turkey wrap with a side of fries. Both sandwiches were fresh, stuffed full of quality cold cuts and tasty (and ran about $8 each.) Unfortunately the the bread was unspectacular, which as my readers know, is a pet peeve of mine.  The fries were piping hot and delicious, but be warned they start at $2.50 for a small order. Adding in a couple of fountain drinks, our total tab came to $24 without tip, which is comparable to its more affluent neighbors. The place was packed and the service was okay even though no one offered to refill our drinks.  A wide selection of tempting desserts are also on display. The black and white cookieos were very enticing; however, I once again chose a couple of rainbow squares at 50 cents each and once again the edges were hard and they did not taste fresh so I cannot recommend the desserts (but I will keep trying.)  I plan to try the Reuben and a Black & White on my next visit. At this point,  although not a Gotta Try, it is a legitimate 4 stars and I have not regretted by-passing its better known neighbors.

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Turkey wrap half.
Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. The Italian Hoagie.
Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Immaculate dining room.

bgUdPL8zMLvqgIbBp84Fuw.text: Stopped in to grab breakfast on a Thursday morning with my Dad.  We were immediately greeted by the owner of the deli.   The deli is decorated in New York Memorabilia.  There is a counter where you order and a small dining area.  There is a dessert and cookie case that greets you as you approach the counter.  I ordered pancakes and bacon and my dad had the same plus eggs.  The pancakes were nice and fluffy, with a nice flavor, and the bacon was crispy.  My dad thought the eggs were mediocre at best.  I bought some whoopie pies before I left, because everything looked so good. Unfortunately, they were dry and I ended up throwing most of them away.  Hopefully I just made a poor choice and the other items are as good as they looked.  I would like to come back and try lunch here, as their sandwiches look delicious.  Nice place with great service.

H3-BvWjmjZlOBk-CLW_gXw.text: My kids and I were regulars here. They have a breakfast menu that is served anytime. The pancakes are sublime. Kids love the pizza slices. I am a fan of the Philly Cheese steak and Pastrami Cheese Sandwich. Absolutely addictive. They offer great daily specials. A great dine-in space that is eclectic focusing on New York memorabilia. Can get very busy in the afternoons but worth the wait. We will miss visiting.

LNUFWVegmHzULhhinrwEKA.text: Dad got the Philly cheese steak and potato salad. Ok but not wow. Mom got salad, not thrilled at all. I got the pastrami and macaroni salad. Good but not wow either. People we're very nice and prices are pretty much the going rate for eating out.

aupZPHs5mT_mbXDSNHRuhw.text: If you miss a NY deli, look no further!  The owner Steve takes pride in his food and caters to his customers with friendliness, NY authenticity and delicious dishes.  The decor will make you feel like your at home.  Secret gem in the heart of Sun Valley!

photos.caption: Photo of Sileo's New York - Indian Trail, NC, United States. Egg, cheese, pepper and onion wrap!  DELISH!!!

T-n0qbrmDi2ninzE-SVvXQ.text: Great place. We had the pastrami melt and the roast beef w/ mozzarella. Both were very flavorful and the meat was tender. Potato salad was delicious. Lots of interesting dessert items available. Wait staff was very friendly and attentive. The owner is there all the time as I understand and he engages with his customers which was great to see. Seating area is a bit small. But loved it here. Would highly recommend!

kPFpOsdGYpjYRK3M9tFicA.text: Great place. Clean. Affordable. The owner, Steve, is also a great guy. I high recommend it.

PKX7mn5WdC9pIho1_p5Ukg.text: Started off with a simple menu choice: chili dog and their home fries. Both were pretty good. This is a small place and it quickly filled up when were there. Service was good. I will try the Philly cheese steak next time.
